title: SQL ServerCONCAT()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerCONCAT()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Add two strings together:
SELECT 
  CONCAT('', '.com');

Definition and Usage
The CONCAT() function adds two or more strings together.
Note:
See also
Concat with the + operator
and
CONCAT_WS()
.
Syntax
CONCAT(
string1
,
string2
,
....
,
string_n
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string1, string2, string_n
Required. The strings to add together
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2012), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Add 3 strings together:
SELECT 
  CONCAT('SQL', ' is', ' fun!');

Example
Add strings together (separate each string with a space character):
SELECT 
  CONCAT('SQL', ' ', 'is', ' ', 'fun!');

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerCONCAT()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerCONCAT()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerCONCAT()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
